stories.text:
Hello! I‘m running a nicely growing Escape Room game, with printed components and an app that serves as the game master. One additional feature is that users can create their own missions, for which the app will then be the game master. It’s used in private, business and educational context, with 2-5 missions created per day. It’s nice to see it being used.

www.escape-team.com

One possible next step would be to allow users to sell their missions - so Escape Team could become a marketplace for that.

But how? If I’d be the seller, paying the creators a commission, that would put a lot of tax issues into my hands, which I do not want.

Is there a platform that you would use for that case? I’d like them to take care of payment (from the players to the platform, which would then split the money between me and the creator), for digital content (voucher codes and PDF links) that my API would post to them (the ‘products’).

Thank you!
stories.title: Ask HN: How would you build a marketplace for user content?
It’s Not Spider-Man’s Fault: Why Best Picture Winners Aren’t Hits Anymore

stories.text:
Gobra is a program verifier for Go programs. It allows programmers to specify their code with contracts and it checks whether the code meets its specification.
It is open-source and available on Github (https://github.com/viperproject/gobra). There is also a VS-Code plugin that allows users to interactively verify their Go programs (https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=viper-admin.gobra-ide).
stories.title: Gobra: A Program Verifier for Go
